intro: Buglossum italicum, commonly known as Italian bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
